input.description:
wsdl location [Optional]
The target WSDL URL for Amazon EC2. The value of this parameter overrides the WSDL URL value provided in adapter configuration. A sample WSDL URL is - http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2009-11-30/AmazonEC2.wsdl

endpoint address [Optional]
The WebService endpoint to use for performing operations on Amazon EC2 instances across different regions. Respective values for different regions are as below:
* http://us-east-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ — Endpoint located in the US-East (Northern Virginia) Region * http://us-west-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ — Endpoint located in the US-West (Northern California) Region * http://eu-west-1.ec2.amazonaws.com/ ---Endpoint located in the EU (Ireland) Region

signature properties [Optional]
Specify this element for including authentication credentials at request level.
Sample values that can be specified are:
<signature-properties mode = "key-files"> <private-key-file></private-key-file> <certificate-file></certificate-file> </signature-properties>
OR
<signature-properties mode = "key-data"> <private-key-data></private-key-data> <certificate-data></certificate-data> </signature-properties>

launch permission [Optional]
Launch permission set.
add - Adds permission remove - Remove permission user-id - AWS Access Key ID group - Name of the group. Currently supports "all"
Sample Structure:
<launch-permission> <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level--> <add> <!--Zero or more repetition --> <item> <user-id></user-id> </item> <item> <group></group> </item> </add> </launch-permission>

product codes [Optional]
Product code set.
<product-codes> <!--Zero or more repetition --> <item> <product-code>?</product-code> </item> </product-codes>

description [Optional]
The description of the AMI.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <amazon-ec2-request> <xsl:if test="string-length('${wsdl location}')>0"> <wsdl-location>${wsdl location}</wsdl-location> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${endpoint address}')>0"> <endpoint-address>${endpoint address}</endpoint-address> </xsl:if> ${signature properties} <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">modify-image-attribute</xsl:text> </operation-name> <parameters> <image-id>${image id}</image-id> ${launch permission}${product codes} <xsl:if test="string-length('${description}')>0"> <description> <value>${description}</value> </description> </xsl:if> </parameters> </amazon-ec2-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Modifies an attribute of an AMI.
